content:
The Franklin Public Library in Franklin, Massachusetts is America’s first lending library. In 1778, when the town was incorporated, the designated name Exeter was changed to Franklin in honor of Dr. Benjamin Franklin. When asked to donate a bell, Franklin responded with an offer of books for the town’s residents, acknowledging that “sense” was preferable to “sound.” The original Franklin collection is still housed in a bookcase in the library.

Reserve Book: Once a book has been located, the user reserves it so that they can pick it up at the front desk later. [Requires a library card.]
Buy Used Books: The user wants to buy some used books.
Get Assistance: The user needs help from a librarian.
Search for Books: The user wants to search the library's catalog for a specific book. [Does not require a library card.]
Get Card: The user needs to get a library card in order to check out books and other materials.
Find Electronic Resources: The user needs help accessing electronic resources provided by the library, such as databases or eBooks. [Requires a library card]
Pick Up A Bus Schedule: Any user can take a free bus schedule at the main desk. [Does not require a library card.]
Obtain A Federal Tax Form: Any user can get a free paper federal tax form. [Does not require a library card.]
Read A Book: Any user can read a book in the library without having to check it out. [Does not require a library card.]

The above are actions someone can take at a library.  You will be expected to assess a statement against these actions to determine which ones fit the statement. You should be open to finding more than one action as long as it is fits the criteria set out in the action description. Your reply should be a json for as many actions as you select and should not include the action description, only the action names.

Statement:

A group of adults are coming to the library for the first time ever.  They don't have library cards yet.

Which actions will the adults have a difficult time doing?

rejected:
In reviewing the list of possible actions based on the statement given, the individuals will most likely want to perform the following actions:

"Get Card": Since they do not currently have a library card, this action would fall into the category of needing to obtain a library card for the first time.

"Get Assistance": At some point, they may wish to speak with a librarian for assistance in learning how to use the library and/or getting oriented around where things are located within the building.

"Search For Books": If they know what books they are interested in checking out, they will eventually want to search the library catalog to locate the desired titles and authors.

"Check Out Books": After locating their desired books using the library catalog, they will then want to checkout those books to take home with them. This process will also involve obtaining a library card.

Since each of these actions requires either having or obtaining a library card, it can be concluded that these particular actions will be challenging for this group of adults since they do not currently possess any library cards.

Therefore, the correct answers are "Get Card", "Get Assistance", "Search for Books", and "Check Out Books".
